dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool is used to update different parameter values in the Configuration files that are used as input to other scripts in this Python Toolbox (Derived Mosaic Dataset, Reference Mosaic Dataset, and Source Mosaic Dataset). The user interface of those tools exposes only the necessary parameters that a user should change, and all other parameters are specified in Configuration file (XML format) which is edited by this tool. If the user changes any of the parameters in the existing file, a NEW configuration file will be generated (in the same folder as the original input file).

tool.name: ToolConfig

param.name: source:input_cfg
param.dialogReference: filename for the Input Configuration file, including path. (Data type is FILE).

param.name: source:outputName
param.dialogReference: filename for the Output Configuration file, (Data type is STRING). The file will be save in the same folder as the input configuration File

param.name: source:cmd
param.dialogReference:
List of the Commands that need to be run on the Mosaic dataset. The List of the commands that can be used are represented by these two letter codes:

• CM = Create Mosaic Datasets.

• AF = Add Fields.

• AR = Add Rasters.

• CR = Create Referenced MDs.

• BF = Build Footprints.

• BB = Build Boundary.

• IF = Import Fields.

• IG = Import Geometry.

• DN = Define NoData values.

• SP = Set Properties.

• SS = Set Statistics.

• CC = Calculate Cell size ranges.

• BO = Build Overviews.

• DO = Define Overviews.

• AI = Add Index.

• CV = Calculate Values.

• BP = Build Pyramids.

Multiple Commands can be merged with "+" sign. For example, Creation of a Mosaic Dataset followed by Add Fields is represented as CM+AF. IMPORTANT: Commands are executed in the sequence entered in this list box.

param.name: source:workspace
param.dialogReference: The path and name of a geodatabase. Note - this tool will not CREATE a geodatabase, so it must exist prior to execution.

param.name: source:srs
param.dialogReference: The coordinate system for the mosaic dataset, which will be used for all the associated files or features created.

param.name: source:datapath
param.dialogReference: Path and name of the input raster data to be added into the Mosaic Dataset. This may be a file, folder, raster dataset, raster catalog, or mosaic dataset, depending on the Raster Type. IMPORTANT NOTE: the other scripts in this toolbox assume a Raster Type for the input data based on their nature (Source Mosaic Dataset presumes input Raster Type is Raster Dataset; Derived Mosaic Dataset: presumes input is multiple Mosaic Datasets, and RasterType is TABLE; Reference Mosaic Dataset restricts input to one single Mosaic Dataset). If this Configuration file will be applied to a Source Mosaic Dataset and any parameters of the Raster Dataset type must be changed from default values, the user must create and save an *.art.xml file to define the Raster Type, and input that *.art.xml file as a parameter here.

param.name: source:artfile
param.dialogReference: Name of the Raster Type or path and filename for an input Raster Type File (.art binary or art.xml file)

param.name: source:artfilter
param.dialogReference: Filter to select a subset of files in the input data directory if not all files are intended to be added into the Mosaic Dataset (e.g. "*.tif" to avoid adding jpg browse images stored in the input image folder)

param.name: source:datasetid
param.dialogReference: A unique identifier (text string) for the input dataset. This label is entered into the Mosaic Dataset Attribute Table for all the rasters added in one Add Raster operation.

param.name: source:le90
param.dialogReference: The LE90 value represents the vertical accuracy of elevation data at a 90% confidence level.

param.name: source:ce90
param.dialogReference: A CE90 value represents the horizontal accuracy of the input data at a 90% confidence level. This is the minimum diameter of the horizontal circle that can be centered on all photo-identifiable Ground Control Points (GCPs) and also contain 90% of their respective twin counterparts acquired in an independent geodetic survey

param.name: source:startdt
param.dialogReference: Start Date for the creation of the source data being added into the Mosaic Dataset.

param.name: source:enddt
param.dialogReference: End date for the creation of the source data being added into the Mosaic Dataset.

param.name: source:source_url
param.dialogReference: The URL for the original source of the data being added into the Mosaic Dataset. This may simply be the source organization, or alternatively a server where the origianl source data can be downloaded.

param.name: source:vert_datum
param.dialogReference: Name of the vertical datum (in the case of elevation data) for the data being added into the Mosaic Dataset.

param.name: source:metadata
param.dialogReference: URL to metadata for the input dataset.

param.name: source:dem_type
param.dialogReference:
Identifier to be set in the Attribute Table for any elevation data being entered into the Mosaic Dataset. Most elevation data will be "bare earth" (dem_type = 2) but others are possible:

Undefined = 0

DSM (first return surface, e.g. buildings, tree canopy) = 1

DTM (bare earth) = 2

Bathymetry = 3

Ice (e.g. ETOPO, GTOPO) = 4

Ellipsoid = 5

Geoid = 6

tool.summary: This tool is used to update different parameter values in the Configuration files that are used as input to other scripts in this Python Toolbox (Derived Mosaic Dataset, Reference Mosaic Dataset, and Source Mosaic Dataset). The user interface of those tools exposes only the necessary parameters that a user should change, and all other parameters are specified in Configuration file (XML format) which is edited by this tool. If the user changes any of the parameters in the existing file, a NEW configuration file will be generated (in the same folder as the original input file).
